content: Thunderbird retains the last saved password at settings>privacy&security. If that is not the current password, you will need to contact your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content:
1. to ensure you have all the messages, click file>offline>download
  2. install importexporttools NG addon
  3. highlight the desired message folders to save
  4. rightclick and select importexport option to export mbox
  5. repeat for al such folders
  6. now, highlight Local Folders
  7. rightclick and select importexport option to import mbox and select one of the exported folders. repeat for the others.
  8. you now have the messages in Local Folders. If you want them online, you can righclick and select COPY TO a desired online folder. (IMAP was not desired for large-scale uploads. If your folder is huge, you may do better by copying in bunches.)
creator: davidsk

content: Yes, local folders are on your hard drive and not tied to accounts . If your account with them is IMAP, you can copy desired content to local folders to preserve them.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks, David, that's really helpful. Thought it would be OK but panicked I might lose my history !
